title: ₹1,000 crore of REI Agro’s attached assets to be liquidated to repay victims in bank fraud case
content: Special court releases assets after no-objection from ED; most claimants are PSU banks cheated to the tune of ₹3,871.71 cr; liquidator cannot sell attached assets to anyone linked to the corporate debtors

title: Study presents mixed picture of MGNREGA implementation in Andhra Pradesh
content: Andhra Pradesh has shown improved participation and reversal of deletions, but work duration and wages continue to slide, as per the new report from LibTech India

title: Principles of liberty, equality and fraternity essential, says Chidambaram MP
content: Thol. Thirumavalavan pays rich tributes to  revolutionary and poet K.G. Sathyamurthy on the latter’s 13th death anniversary

title: Karnataka caste census: Further discussion deferred to Cabinet meeting in May
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has asked his Cabinet colleagues to submit in writing their opinion on the survey, even if it is a dissent note

title: Life under the big top and beyond
content: As the circus industry heads to its sunset years, Nainu Oommen meets a few artistes at their camps and homes in Kannur to rekindle the memories of their golden days in the ring and on the trapeze. April 19 is  World Circus Day.

title: BJP leaders visit sewage treatment plant at Appu Ghar in Visakhapatnam
content: Officials of a private firm assures the party leaders that the muddy water will be treated before release into the sea

title: Nanguneri SC boy who was attacked by gang not cooperating with investigators: police
content: He even refuses to share his social media and e-mail IDs and the passwords, which are needed for identifying the attackers as he had been invited by the ‘unidentified friend’ to come to the secluded place through the social media, police say.

title: Start of the end? Hamas fighters go unpaid as cash network implodes under Israeli siege
content: Hamas faces a severe cash shortage in Gaza due to tightened Israeli restrictions and military actions, crippling its ability to pay fighters and employees. Israeli forces have targeted key financial operatives, disrupting fund distribution, while restrictions on aid and currency further strain Gaza's economy. This financial crisis undermines Hamas's recruitment efforts and control, exacerbating hardships for Gazan civilians already struggling with war and basic needs.

title: 'Apologise for genocide': B'desh to Pak over 1971 liberation war crimes
content: Bangladesh urged Pakistan to formally apologize for the 1971 genocide and address unresolved bilateral issues to improve future relations. Pakistan expressed readiness for discussions on these matters, marking a resumption of talks after a 14-year hiatus. While previous calls for apology were made, current focus is on resolving lingering issues for stronger ties.

title: Varun Chakravarthy weighs in on controversial no-ball during MI vs SRH
content: KKR spinner Varun Chakravarthy has questioned the no-ball call during the MI vs SRH match, triggered by Heinrich Klaasen's glove placement. The incident saw Ryan Rickelton initially dismissed, then revived by the umpire's intervention, sparking debate over the fairness to the bowler. Despite the controversy, MI defeated SRH by five wickets, continuing their winning momentum after restricting SRH to 162/5.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Tesla investor Ross Gerber has intensified his criticism of Elon Musk, asserting that Musk's focus has shifted away from the electric car manufacturer, particularly towards his new venture, X AI. Gerber defends his stance amidst backlash, citing negative publicity stemming from Musk's actions. Despite concerns and a 33% year-to-date stock decline, Gerber's firm retains Tesla shares, anticipating a potential turnaround.

title: PDP hits back at NC over Article 370, cites ‘deals with BJP’
content: The PDP and NC are engaged in a heated dispute over the abrogation of Article 370, sparked by claims in a new book. PDP defends its alliance with BJP as principled and aimed at protecting Article 370, while accusing NC of secret deals with the BJP. Mehbooba Mufti alleges Omar Abdullah proposed an NC-BJP alliance after the 2014 elections.

title: Viral video: Chahal brutally trolls his IPL teammate, calls him...
content: Yuzvendra Chahal, fresh from a match-winning 4/28 against KKR in IPL 2025, playfully teased teammate Nehal Wadhera, dubbing him a "mistri spinner" after a practice session. Chahal's performance equaled Sunil Narine’s record for most four-wicket hauls in IPL and helped PBKS defend a low total. He also surpassed Mohammad Nabi and Mohammad Amir to become India’s top T20 wicket-taker.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai responds to Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis making it to Time Magazine cover
content: Google's Sundar Pichai congratulated Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, on being featured on Time Magazine's cover and included in the 2025 Time100 list. Jennifer Doudna, a Nobel laureate, lauded Hassabis's AI research, particularly AlphaFold's impact on biology and medicine.

title: Active shooter at Florida state university, four injured
content: On April 17, 2025, Florida State University's alert system reported an active shooter near the Student Union, prompting an immediate lockdown. Students and staff were instructed to shelter in place, lock doors and windows, and prepare for further safety measures.

title: Trump's tariff war on China: 5 reasons why Xi may blink first
content: Donald Trump has slapped up to 245% tariffs on China. China says it is not afraid of a trade war. China wants dialogue based on equality. But China faces economic challenges. Exports power China’s economy. China's domestic market is weak. The Communist Party’s legitimacy is at stake. Trump's trade policy is easier to escalate. Both Trump and Xi Jinping are in a faceoff.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke to parents: Make your kid learn …
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke advocates for early coding education in schools, likening it to core subjects. He highlights AI's role in democratizing software development, enabling smaller teams to achieve significant results. While acknowledging concerns about job displacement, Dohmke emphasizes continuous learning and adaptation for developers in the age of AI.

title: Good Friday 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages, quotes, images and cards
content: Good Friday in 2025 falls on April 18. Christians worldwide will observe the day with prayers and reflection. The day marks Jesus Christ's sacrifice. Believers will focus on love, forgiveness, and salvation. Many will fast and abstain from meat. The day offers a reminder of Jesus's love. It is a time for spiritual reflection. People will share wishes and quotes.

title: Angad Bumrah's wicket celebration with mother Sanjana goes viral
content: Jasprit Bumrah's son celebrated his father's crucial dismissal of Heinrich Klaasen during the Mumbai Indians versus Sunrisers Hyderabad match. Bumrah's impressive yorker uprooted Klaasen's off-stump, limiting SRH's momentum.

title: Google's digital ad network declared illegal monopoly
content: A federal judge has ruled that Google illegally monopolized the publisher ad server and ad exchange markets, marking a significant setback in its antitrust battle with the US government. While the judge didn't find a monopoly in advertiser ad networks, this ruling opens the door for potential remedies, including a forced breakup of Google's advertising business.

title: 'I’m here to help': Trump gets praise from Mark Cuban for latest healthcare order
content: Mark Cuban has voiced his support for Donald Trump's healthcare executive order, deeming it a potentially transformative move for the nation. The billionaire believes the drug pricing reforms could yield substantial savings by curbing the influence of pharmacy benefit managers. Cuban advocates for data transparency, independent formulary management, and the protection of independent pharmacies.

title: Governor Rejects Mamata Banerjee's Request To Not Visit Riot-Hit Murshidabad
content: West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose has decided to leave for the communal violence-hit Murshidabad district on Thursday night, ignoring requests from Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee earlier in the day to refrain from visiting the district.

title: INDIA Bloc Panel Led By Tejashwi Yadav To Chalk Out Plan For Bihar Polls
content: Constituents of the INDIA bloc in Bihar on Thursday formed a coordination committee headed by RJD's Tejashwi Yadav to deliberate upon a common minimum programme for the assembly polls due later this year.

title: Amid Violence Over Waqf In Bengal, BJP Begins Outreach In Northeast
content: Amid ongoing protests by the Congress and Trinamool Congress against the amended Waqf law in Bengal, the Tripura unit of the ruling BJP has announced a statewide counter-campaign to raise public awareness, especially among the minority Muslim communi

title: "Like A Child...": A Owaisi On Judicial Overreach Allegations Over Waqf
content: The judiciary is independent and has a duty to check whether a law confirms to the Constitution, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said today when asked about allegations of judicial over-reach after the Supreme Court decided to hear the petitions challen

title: Active Shooter At Florida University Campus, Some Injured: Report
content: An active shooter was reported Thursday on the Florida State University campus in Tallahassee, according to the school's alert system.

title: "Will Get America-Like Highways": Nitin Gadkari Unveils Rs 4,000 Crore Project In Odisha
content: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Thursday said Odisha will soon get America-like highways. Unveiling 19 national highway projects worth Rs 4,137 crore in the state, he said road connectivity will boost tourism in the state.

title: Amid Tariff War, Trump Says Confident Of Making "Very Good Deal" With China
content: Donald Trump believes it is up to China, not the United States, to come to the negotiating table on trade, the White House said Tuesday, after the US president accused Beijing of reneging on a major Boeing deal.

title: In Talks With Pak, Bangladesh Seeks Public Apology For 1971 Atrocities
content: Bangladesh raised "historically unresolved issues" and sought a public apology from Pakistan over the 1971 atrocities as the two countries held their first foreign secretary-level talks in 15 years here on Thursday.

title: "Shame We're Living In This Condition": Delhi High Court Directs Clearing Of Drains
content: The Delhi High Court on Thursday directed the removal of structures blocking a drain in southeast Delhi and said it was a "shame" people lived in such conditions in the national capital.

title: "No One Objected": Minister After Karnataka Cabinet Meeting On Caste Census
content: A special cabinet meeting that was convened to discuss the contentious Social and Educational Survey report, popularly known as 'caste census' in Karnataka, on Thursday was inconclusive, and ended without any major decision.

title: 17-Year-Old Stabs Husband, Shows Body To Lover On Video Call: Police
content: A 25-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death with a broken beer bottle by his 17-year-old wife and her lover's friends in Madhya Pradesh's Burhanpur, police said on Thursday.

title: Wealth Of Russia's Richest Rises Over 8% To $625.5 Billion
content: Russia's richest people saw their wealth rise by more than 8% to $625.5 billion over the past year, with at least 146 billionaires listed by the Forbes Russian-language list of the wealthiest people in Russia.

title: Russia Removes Taliban's 'Terrorist Group' Label To Build Friendly Ties
content: Russia's Supreme Court on Thursday removed the Taliban's designation as a "terrorist organisation", a symbolic gesture aimed at building friendly ties with Afghanistan's de facto rulers.

title: Donald Trump Now Wants To Deport US Citizens And Jail Them In Foreign Prisons
content: The idea of outsourcing US prison operations to El Salvador is not new. In February, Bukele posted on social media about his country's offer to take in convicted US citizens, including those with violent offenses, in exchange for a fee.

title: Why Haven't We Come In Contact With Aliens? Fermi's Paradox Explained
content: Astronomers raised hopes that humanity might not be alone in the universe by announcing on Thursday they have detected the most promising hints yet of life on a distant planet.

title: Shortsellers Targeted Many Companies Ahead Of Trump's Tariff Announcement
content: Shortsellers targeted a wider range of equity sectors in March before US President Donald Trump's April 2 "Liberation Day" tariff announcement and raised negative bets on a cluster of big tech stocks.

title: Space Tech, Public Participation: PM Modi Reviews Yamuna Rejuvenation Plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi-headed review meeting on Yamuna rejuvenation on Thursday discussed measures like public participation and the use of real-time data and space technology to revive the heavily polluted river, said a statement.

title: Experts link Buldhana patients’ nail deformities, hair loss cases to selenium exposure
content: Health experts had said that the wheat sourced from Punjab and Haryana, and distributed through ration shops in Buldhana, were noted to contain significantly high levels of selenium

title: Congress says Supreme Court’s observation on Waqf echoes concerns raised by INDIA bloc
content: The party says its opposition to the amended law is not just to defend a particular community but to protect constitutional principles

title: Dhaka’s actions led to India’s closure of transshipment facility for Bangladesh: MEA
content: Sources say Bangladesh’s closure of land ports with India has been viewed as a “regressive step”; officials also point to cargo inspections, stoppage of yarn imports

title: IT Park development in 450 acres in Puppalaguda: Telangana Deputy CM Bhatti
content: The land earmarked for the IT hub includes areas previously allotted to the housing societies of MLAs, MPs, IAS officers and revenue officials

title: Mamata appeals to Governor to not visit Murshidabad; Bose says he wants to see ground situation
content: ‘I am going to the field to see for myself the realities in the field. Only then, I will be able to make up my mind on the future course of action and give reports to whoever is concerned,’ the Governor said

title: Tejashwi to lead INDIA alliance co-ordination committee for Bihar election
content: The co-ordination committee would be responsible for all election related issues including seat-sharing, manifesto and campaign strategy; no talks held yet on CM face

title: India’s airport expansion plans need revised seat agreements: Dubai airport CEO
content: Dubai’s second airport, which will replace the current primary hub in mid-2030s, is set to open after first phase of expansion in 2027 with an annual capacity of 150 million passengers

title: Organ pledging: Karnataka has the fourth highest number of registrations
content: The highest pledging has been recorded in the age group of 30-45 years with 16,045 persons in this age group pledging their organs

title: Hurriyat chairperson Mirwaiz welcomes interim SC directions in Waqf Act case
content: Kashmir’s chief cleric Mirwaiz Umar Farooq said the interim directions gave “hope to Muslims, who look up to the SC as their last recourse for relief and justice”

title: J&K High Court directs police to submit report in Kathua case of alleged police torture
content: The victim’s family has moved the court to seek the transfer of the probe to the Central Bureau of Investigation, ‘so that the investigation is conducted fairly and independently and in an impartial manner’

title: Andhra Pradesh promulgates Ordinance on sub-classification of Scheduled Castes
content: It seeks to provide a legal framework to classify the communities into three sub-groups to address disparities in representation and access to welfare schemes

title: Rohit maintains upward trend, posts his highest IPL 2025 score
content: Rohit Sharma showed signs of resurgence in IPL 2025, scoring a brisk 26 off 16 balls against Sunrisers Hyderabad, marked by three sixes and glimpses of his vintage form. Despite a promising start, his innings was cut short by Pat Cummins. Earlier, Rohit was honored with the “IPL 18” memento, celebrating his remarkable journey and impact on the league.

title: Supreme Court or 'Super Parliament'? VP Dhankhar flags judiciary 'overreach'
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar has voiced serious concerns regarding the handling of the case involving Justice Yashwant Varma, following the discovery of semi-burnt cash at his residence. Dhankhar questioned the lack of a formal investigation and FIR, emphasizing that the rule of law must apply to everyone.

title: India takes swipe at Pak's 'reputation' after bid to disown Rana
content: Following Tahawwur Hussain Rana's extradition, India's Ministry of External Affairs urged Pakistan to take action against those responsible for the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks. Rana, a key accused, is now in NIA custody for interrogation regarding the broader conspiracy, which targeted multiple Indian cities.

title: 'China supplying weapons to Russia', Zelenskyy makes shock claim
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accused China of supplying weapons to Russia and aiding in their production on Russian soil. This claim contradicts China's previously stated neutral stance and denial of providing lethal weapons. Zelenskyy is urging increased international pressure on Russia to end the three-year war, amidst ongoing deadly attacks.

title: Suryakumar Yadav checks Abhishek Sharma’s pocket for a note
content: During the Mumbai Indians versus Sunrisers Hyderabad match, Suryakumar Yadav playfully checked Abhishek Sharma's pocket, referencing Sharma's previous century celebration where he revealed a note. Sharma scored 40 off 28 balls amidst a struggling SRH batting performance. Despite early reprieves and a brief flurry of boundaries, his momentum was cut short.

title: 'Did not attack Indian pharma warehouse': Russia blames Ukraine
content: The Russian embassy in India has refuted Ukraine's accusation that Russian forces targeted an Indian pharmaceutical company's warehouse in Kyiv. Ukraine claimed the attack was a deliberate act against Indian businesses, despite Russia's professed friendship with India.

title: Travis Head reaches a unique milestone after his slowest IPL knock
content: Travis Head became the second-fastest player to reach 1000 IPL runs, achieving the milestone in 575 balls during a match against Mumbai Indians. Andre Russell holds the record at 545 balls. Despite this achievement, Head's innings was slow, scoring 28 off 29 balls.

title: 'Tariff wars may raise costs': Sitharaman warns of fallout amid US-China rift
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed global trade policy challenges at the Bombay Stock Exchange's 150th anniversary. She emphasized India's resilience amid global volatility, citing strong macroeconomic fundamentals and growing domestic strength. Sitharaman highlighted the increasing role of domestic institutional investors and urged corporates to prioritize transparency.

title: Watch: After Kohli, Rohit honoured with special IPL recognition
content: Rohit Sharma, following Virat Kohli, was honored with a special IPL memento for his 18 seasons. BCCI President Roger Binny presented the award before Mumbai Indians' game against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Sharma, who began with Deccan Chargers in 2008, led Mumbai Indians to five IPL titles, solidifying his legacy as a successful captain and influential player.

title: Trade barriers are costly, but global recession unlikely: IMF chief
content: IMF head Kristalina Georgieva says a global recession is unlikely. This is despite trade tensions sparked by US tariffs. However, these trade disruptions will cost significantly. The IMF expects markdowns to global growth. Georgieva urges countries to adjust fiscal policy. She also wants central bank independence. China should boost domestic consumption. The US must address surging public debt.

title: 'Vacate PoK': India after Pak army chief rakes up two-nation theory
content: India strongly refuted Pakistan's "two-nation" theory, asserting that Pakistan's sole connection to India is the liberation of illegally occupied territories. This response followed Pakistan's army chief's endorsement of the theory, emphasizing fundamental differences between Hindus and Muslims. Assam's Chief Minister reacted by stressing the need to strengthen India's nationhood, dharma, and civilizational values.

title: 'China wants to meet': Trump makes big claim as trade war intensifies
content: Amid escalating trade tensions, President Trump claimed China desires a meeting, though Beijing hasn't confirmed. Trump cited productive talks with Mexico and Japan. China signals willingness to negotiate if the US shows respect, stabilizes trade policy, addresses sanctions and Taiwan concerns, and appoints a supported negotiator. China insists on equality and mutual benefit for resolving the dispute.

title: Tristan Stubbs living his childhood dream
content: Tristan Stubbs, fueled by his lifelong admiration for KL Rahul, played a match-winning role in Delhi Capitals' Super Over victory. His father, Christopher Stubbs, witnessed his son's heroics and met Rahul, praising his gentlemanly demeanor. Christopher believes Delhi Capitals have a balanced team capable of winning their first IPL title, anticipating more impactful partnerships between Stubbs and Rahul.

title: After 'too slow' sledging , Jaiswal, Starc's chatter goes viral – Watch
content: After a thrilling IPL match between Delhi Capitals and Rajasthan Royals, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Mitchell Starc shared a friendly moment. This contrasted their earlier sledging incident during a Test series. Jaiswal asked Starc about his Delhi experience. Both players previously played for Kolkata Knight Riders. Their sportsmanship is being praised by fans. The moment highlights respect in cricket.

title: How 18-yo Suruchi Singh became India's new shooting sensation
content: Suruchi Singh, coached by Suresh Singh, achieved remarkable success in shooting. She won multiple gold medals at national and international events, including the ISSF World Cup. Her discipline and determination, instilled by her coach, transformed her into a sharpshooter. Suruchi balances her shooting career with helping her family on their farm in Jhajjar.

title: "Could Have Been...": Russia Denies Attack On Indian Firm's Kyiv Warehouse
content: Russia has refuted allegations by Ukraine that a Russian missile struck the warehouse of an Indian pharma firm in Kyiv last week.

title: "Shameful, Shocking": Rahul Gandhi On Minor's Rape In UP
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday lashed out at the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh over the alleged rape of an 11-year-old Dalit girl and demanded strict action against the culprit.

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) backs Mamata’s claim, accuses BJP of fuelling Bengal violence
content: “Wherever the BJP fails to form a government — be it Kerala, Tamil Nadu, or Bengal — they try to create unrest”

title: Paddy harvesting picks up in Yadgir
content: But growers in the district are worrying over the yield falling short of their expectation due to shortage of water during a crucial period

title: IUML has no moral right to oppose amendment while eyeing Waqf land, says INL leader
content: He alleged that 22 acres, originally owned by a tax-paying Jamaat mosque and leased for 99 years to the college, had effectively been appropriated by the IUML-controlled CDMEA

title: India’s defence sector ready to play important role in global supply chain resilience, says Rajnath
content: Defence Minister noted that domestic defence capabilities serve as credible deterrence, maintaining peace and tranquillity in a dual bid to ensure national security and strategic autonomy.

title: TNPCB report shows high level of mercury contamination in water sources near NLCIL
content: The TNPCB study, with water samples collected on December 17, 2024, was undertaken following the intervention of the NGT, the report of which was submitted on Wednesday

title: Mayawati cautions Dalits amid SP outreach, terms statements as politics of narrow selfishness
content: The former Uttar Pradesh CM asks Dalits, backward classes, and minorities not to fall prey to the SP’s tactics

title: As bike taxi ban looms, Bengalureans turn to carpooling for daily commute
content: For thousands of daily commuters, bike taxis have been a low-cost, time-saving solution in the traffic-congested city.

title: National Herald an open-and-shut case of fraud, corruption, and money laundering, alleges BJP
content: At a press conference, senior BJP leader and Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri says the Congress workers should protest against their own leadership for allegedly misusing a charitable entity and the party’s resources for their own personal gain

title: ASI finds centuries-old rock art sites in Mizoram
content: The discoveries were made during a survey conducted across villages in four districts, officials said

title: Palghar district in Maharashtra trains 259 gram panchayats in disaster management
content: Earlier such kits were only distributed among the Tehsildars in taluka level and fire brigades; this is the first time that gram panchayats are being given disaster kits

title: Nellore IAB allocates 41 tmcft water for over 3 lakh acres in Rabi season
content: Water from Somasila reservoir will be released to the crop canals from May 5, says Endowments during the IAB meeting

title: Environment Ministry must roll back order on desulphurising coal plants: study
content: The study was commissioned by the Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser, and executed by the National Institute of Advanced Studies, Bengaluru

title: Tension in Tirupati as police place YSRCP leader Karunakar Reddy under house arrest
content: Accepting the challenge thrown by the TDP, the former TTD chairman vowed to visit the Goshala to prove his charges on cow deaths

title: JEE Mains session 2 final answer key released: Check direct link to download
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the final answer key for JEE Main 2025 Session 2, following the exam held from April 2 to 9. Candidates can now access it on the official website, jeemain.nta.nic.in. This comes after the provisional key and objection window. Results are expected soon, with over 10 lakh candidates having appeared.

title: Rs 50-crore wolfdog was a hoax? What ED said
content: Bengaluru breeder S Satish's claim of acquiring a Rs 50-crore "wolfdog" has been exposed as a hoax by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). Investigations revealed that Satish did not possess the exotic canine, Cadaboms Okami, nor did he have any documentation to support the alleged purchase.

title: VP takes on SC over deadline for President to decide on Bills
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar has criticized the Supreme Court's directive setting a timeline for the President to decide on bills, arguing it undermines the constitutional role of the office. He questioned the judiciary's authority to issue such directives, emphasizing the President's immunity from prosecution.

title: Blue Jays star Guerrero Jr's reaction on his first home run raises eyebrows
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his first home run of the 2025 MLB season during a game between the Toronto Blue Jays and Atlanta Braves. His reaction to the home run, which included an expletive, caught the attention of Braves announcer Brandon Gaudin. This occurred after Guerrero Jr. signed a $500 million extension deal with the Blue Jays.

title: Bold picks! Williamson includes two Indians in his next 'Fab Five'
content: In a recent interview, Kane Williamson, a modern "Fab Four" member, identified his "upcoming Fab Five" for cricketing greatness. He listed Yashasvi Jaiswal, Shubman Gill, Rachin Ravindra, Harry Brook, and Cameron Green as players with the potential to become future legends. These young stars have already begun making significant impacts with their unique skills and performances in Test cricket.

title: After two decades, Russia lifts Taliban's designation as 'terrorist organisation'
content: Russia's Supreme Court has removed the Taliban from its list of terrorist organizations, a designation in place since 2003. This decision follows increasing diplomatic engagement between Moscow and the Taliban, particularly after the group's 2021 takeover of Afghanistan. While formal recognition is pending, this move signifies a notable shift in Russia's foreign policy, aligning it with other regional powers.

title: Vulgar remarks: File FIR against Ponmudy or face contempt, HC tells police
content: The Madras high court has cautioned the Tamil Nadu Police to file an FIR against DMK minister K Ponmudy for his disrespectful remarks about women, or face contempt charges. This warning follows demands from BJP leaders for action against Ponmudy. While Ponmudy has apologized and been removed from his party post, he remains a minister.

title: Situation under control in violence-hit Murshidabad, Bengal tells HC
content: The Calcutta High Court has reserved its decision regarding the continued deployment of central forces in West Bengal's Murshidabad, following recent violent clashes. A suggestion has been made to form a panel to assess the situation and aid rehabilitation. The court is also considering a plea to transfer the investigation of bomb blasts during communal violence to the NIA, while the state government claims the situation is under control.

title: No Waqf appointment, status quo till next hearing, says SC
content: The Supreme Court has temporarily suspended key provisions of the Waqf Act, directing the government to maintain the status quo until the next hearing. This decision comes amid challenges to the Act's constitutional validity, with concerns raised about the registration of waqfs by user and potential impacts on existing properties.

title: CM Fadnavis summoned over plea challenging his 2024 Maha poll win
content: The Bombay High Court has issued summons to Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis regarding a petition challenging his 2024 victory in the Nagpur South West assembly seat. Congress' Prafulla Vinodrao Gudadhe filed the petition, alleging procedural lapses and corrupt practices during the election. The court has set a returnable date for the summons on May 8.

title: Bypoll: Congress undecided between two aspirants in Nilambur
content: V.S. Joy,  president of Malappuram District Congress Committee,  and  Aryadan Shoukath, State general secretary of Congress, are firm on their candidacy

title: Akshaya entrepreneurs cry out for service fee revision
content: Repeated memoranda to the State government for the revision of service fee invoked no response despite the district and State offices of the Akshaya project flagging the concerns of Akshaya entrepreneurs

title: Fiction created by propagandists being passed on as history, says JNU V-C
content: Instead of teaching historical assertions based on facts, the propagandist is trying to create a picture of the past based on hearsay, conjectures, and outright lies, says Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit

title: Pinarayi lone non-BJP CM not targeted by ED, says Muraleedharan
content: The Congress leader points out that politicians such as former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren were tortured by the ED

title: Rail users come up with a slew of demands ahead of MPs’ meeting with Southern Railway GM
content: Members of Parliament from the areas under the purview of the Tiruchi Railway Division are likely to meet Southern Railway General Manager next week; the demands of the associations range from track doubling to extension of existing trains

title: India ‘in touch’ with students facing visa issues in the U.S.
content: As students go to court in the U.S., MEA softens position from earlier advice to simply comply with U.S. rules; suggests legal route for injunctions against deportation; 30% drop in U.S. student visas to Indians

title: Migrants from Murshidabad in Perumbavoor keeping a close watch on violence back home
content: There has been no panic-driven exodus from among the community of migrant workers from Murshidabad in West Bengal, though they remain on tenterhooks about the happenings back home

title: AP Chambers urges 16th Finance Commission to increase devolution of Central tax revenues to States like Andhra Pradesh
content: Andhra Pradesh’s per capita income is lowest among the Southern States, largely due to bifurcation, it says, adding that the State be granted funds liberally considering it as a special case

title: New road laid in Bhadrachalam Agency as part of renewed thrust on improving road connectivity in LWE affected areas
content: Work on the 2-km BT road between Pusuguppa in Charla mandal and Rampuram in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur district has been completed in a mission mode under the round-the-clock security cover of the district police and the CRPF personnel

title: YSRCP welcomes Supreme Court interim orders on Waqf Board Amendment Act
content: Former MLA of the party Hafeez Khan criticises Andhra Pradesh and Bihar Chief Ministers for supporting BJP on the issue

title: Kashappanavar named chairman of Panchamasali Trust
content: Amid the imbroglio within the community over Lingayat Panchamasali seer Basava Jaya Mrutunjya Swami’s open support to expelled BJP leader Basanagouda Patil Yatnal, former legislator Vijayanand Kashappanavar has been named as the new chairman of ‘Akhila Bharat Lingayat Panchamasali Samaj Trust’.

title: Discourses on Sharanas starting Sunday as part of Basava Jayanti events in Hubballi
content: The Basava Kendra has planned a series of such events as part of the birth anniversary celebrations of the State’s cultural icon

title: Tension eases in Palakkad as parties agree to police terms
content: BJP and Youth Congress had taken out marches, each targeting the other’s district office, amidst an escalating stand-off over naming a skill development centre after  RSS founder K.B. Hedgewar

title: Muslims could be reduced to a minority in Waqf Boards under new Act
content: New Act empowers State governments to hand-pick persons of any religion to be appointed to key positions in the boards to influence its decisions, say legal experts

title: Five air-conditioned bus shelters reopened in Nellore
content: Built during the previous tenure between 2014 and 2019, these facilities were not maintained properly during the last five years, says Nellore Rural MLA

title: NCC Director-General Gurbirpal Singh to visit Kerala
content: He will meet Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan during the five-day visit scheduled to commence on April 19

title: LDF govt. set to turn fourth anniversary celebrations into mass outreach event to showcase its achievements
content: The celebrations, to be inaugurated by Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan at Kasaragod on April 21 at 10 a.m., are expected to set the tone for the LDF’s campaign for a third consecutive term

title: Rodgers still unsure on future, rips Jets for exit
content: Future Hall of Fame quarterback Aaron Rodgers said Thursday on "The Pat McAfee Show" that he is not ready to make a decision on his plans for the 2025 season and allowed that retirement could still be a possibility.

title: Sources: Lillard taken off blood-thinning meds
content: Bucks star Damian Lillard has been cleared of his deep vein thrombosis and is no longer on blood-thinning medication, sources told ESPN.

title: Corso to end four-decade run with 'GameDay'
content: ESPN analyst Lee Corso, widely known for his headgear picks and "not so fast, my friend" retort, will retire from "College GameDay" in August.

title: Lopez suspended for throwing at McCutchen
content: Nationals reliever Jorge Lopez has been suspended three games for intentionally throwing at Pirates outfielder Andrew McCutchen.

title: Jets lock down Pionk with 6-year, $42M extension
content: The Jets have signed Neal Pionk to a six-year, $42 million contract extension before the defenseman could hit free agency.

title: Report: Security failures led to Miami Copa chaos
content: Officials for Miami-Dade County said a lack of intelligence gathering, insufficient security perimeters and large numbers of unticketed fans led to the chaotic scene that unfolded ahead of last year's Copa América final.

title: Sources: Perry set for Kings return as new GM
content: The Kings are finalizing a deal to hire longtime NBA executive Scott Perry as their new general manager, sources told ESPN.

title: Report: Rangers' Panarin settled after accusation
content: The NHL says the Rangers informed the league last year that they were looking into sexual assault allegations by a team employee against Artemi Panarin after a report detailing the situation and settlement payments made to the woman surfaced.

title: 'I found your dad': The mystery of a missing climber
content: Bill Stampfl vanished climbing Peru's highest mountain 22 years ago. This is the story of the hiker who found him and brought closure to Stampfl's family.

title: ‘I’ll beat you tomorrow for $10k’: Inside the secret world of MLB pickleball
content: Here's how the pickleball court is replacing the golf course as where the baseball world gets away from the game.

title: NBA postseason preview: Stars, matchups and X factors that could decide the champion
content: Everything you need to know about the teams battling it out in the postseason, including first-round matchups.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: Winners and losers: Picks we loved -- and picks that left us scratching our heads
content: Will Sedona Prince play in the WNBA? Is Dominique Malonga a future MVP? We revisit all the WNBA draft picks.

title: What Wings can expect from Paige Bueckers in Year 1
content: All-Star? MVP? Or Hall of Famer? GMs break down what to expect from Bueckers' rookie season -- and beyond.

title: How little old Vanderbilt is making noise in the big, bad SEC
content: From beating Bama to boasting a brash QB, Clark Lea and the Commodores are convinced the best is yet to come.

title: Ideal landing spots for 10 of this year's rookies
content: A fantasy manager's guide to the ideal team fits for selected rookies such as Cam Ward and Ashton Jeanty.

title: Champions League semifinal predictions: Arsenal or PSG? Barcelona or Inter Milan?
content: We're down to the final four in Europe's top club competition, so who do we think has the power, talent and grit to reach the final? Our writers make their picks.

title: Ancelotti: Madrid future in doubt after UCL exit
content: Carlo Ancelotti said he "doesn't know" if Real Madrid's 2-1 Champions League defeat to Arsenal on Wednesday was his last game in charge of Madrid in the competition.

title: Van Dijk signs contract extension at Liverpool
content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has signed a contract extension, putting an end to speculation over whether this season would be his last at Anfield.

title: Neymar exits in tears after fresh injury setback
content: Neymar suffered a fresh injury setback when the Brazil star was forced to leave Santos' match with Atlético-MG due to a left thigh injury.

title: Bayern's Josip Stanisic regrets pushing ball boy
content: Bayern Munich's Josip Stanisic said it was "stupid" of him to push a ball boy off his stool in stoppage time of their Champions League match vs. Inter Milan.

title: Arsenal deliver 'proudest night' for Arteta vs. Real
content: Mikel Arteta is targeting Champions League glory after celebrating his "proudest night" as Arsenal manager on Wednesday as the Gunners knocked out holders Real Madrid to reach their first semifinal since 2009.

title: Martinelli: 'Dream' to score at Madrid like Henry
content: Gabriel Martinelli was ecstatic to follow in the footsteps of Arsenal legend Thierry Henry by scoring at the Bernabeú in Wednesday's 2-1 win at Real Madrid.

title: Kompany: Injuries were 'big issue' in Bayern exit
content: Bayern Munich earned a draw at the San Siro against Inter Milan on Wednesday but ultimately bowed out of the Champions League, leaving manager Vincent Kompany to reflect on the injury crisis that hit his side ahead of the quarter-final.

title: Ex-MLS forward dies following fall from 11th floor
content: Gabon forward Aaron Boupendza has died at 28 following a fall from the 11th floor of a building in China, the Gabonese Football Federation has said.

title: Carroll hits 35 homers? Soderstrom hits 50? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Transfer tracker: Latest entrants and commitments
content: The transfer cycle is in full swing. We're tracking the latest players to enter the portal and commit.

title: How Liverpool sealed Salah, Van Dijk contracts amid struggle to keep Alexander-Arnold
content: Mohamed Salah and Virgil van Dijk have committed their futures to Liverpool, but how did the club convince them to stay? And will that persuade Trent Alexander-Arnold to snub Real Madrid?

title: John Cena's most memorable WrestleMania matches
content: Before Cena dons the jorts a final time at WrestleMania, we look at 10 matches that have shaped his legacy.

content: Andreas Hale and Nick Parkinson share their thoughts on the May 2 card in Times Square, Usyk's next fight and more.

content: 2K Games has signed a multi-year deal with a tournament platform provider for NBA 2K25 and upcoming iterations of the franchise.

content: "this is going to be the next kid that plays on Sundays," he says . the coaches had coached Tiger Bech, his older brother, an aggressive, fiery, but diminutive all-purpose talent . "Before Jack, Tiger was the best receiver we've ever had," says coach .

title: PFL best bets: How Impa Kasanganay can bounce back
content: Impa Kasanganay, who won the 2023 light heavyweight season, takes on Fabian Edwards in one of four middleweight bouts . the card at Universal Studios also features four lightweight bouts, including Gadzhi Rabadanov taking on Marc Diakiese .

title: In Jade Carey's final meet, can she win the NCAA all-around title?
content: JADE CAREY is one of the country's most decorated elite gymnasts . the 24-year-old will represent Oregon State for the last time at the NCAA championships in Fort Worth, Texas . she has won three gold medals and three world championship titles . her love for Oregon State has never wavered .

title: 'Yeet!': The unexpected and highly unlikely rise of WWE's Jey Uso
content: JEY USO is not supposed to be in the world heavyweight title match vs. Gunther . he never dreamed of standing tall by himself at WrestleMania as a champion . jey and Jimmy Uso have accomplished everything a tag team could want in WWE .

title: Spring transfer portal: Recapping news, rumors and analysis from Day 1
content:
Pete Thamel tells Pat McAfee that Nico Iamaleava is unlikely find a situation where he gets his asking price through the portal. (1:17) College football 's spring transfer portal period opened Wednesday and runs through April 25. More than  2,700 players  have elected to transfer this offseason. This period is the last chance for underclassmen to switch teams before the start of the 2025 season and for schools to bolster their roster. The biggest news of the spring period happened this past weekend when  Tennessee   parted ways  with quarterback  Nico Iamaleava . The former four-star recruit, who threw 19 touchdown passes in 2024, was seeking an increase in his  NIL package . He is now looking for a new home, and  UCLA is in the hunt . With players officially able to enter their names in the portal, we tracked all the latest news and developments. Here's a look at how Day 1 unfolded.  Transfer portal coverage: 
 Best available player rankings
